function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Limited data on the effectiveness of UV air disinfection in preventing airborne transmission of viral aerosols such as SARS coronavirus.","Impact":"Increased risk of airborne transmission of viral aerosols including SARS coronavirus.","Mitigation":"Conduct comprehensive studies to evaluate the effectiveness of UV air disinfection and develop alternative mitigation strategies if necessary.","Technologies":"UV air disinfection, air filtration systems, ventilation systems.","People":"General public, healthcare workers, individuals in crowded or enclosed spaces.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health authorities, government agencies."},{"Description":"Uncertain relationship between relative humidity (RH) and UV inactivation rate of bacterial aerosols.","Impact":"Difficulty in predicting and controlling UV inactivation of bacterial aerosols based on RH.","Mitigation":"Conduct research to characterize the effect of RH on UV inactivation rate and develop models or guidelines for UV disinfection under different RH conditions.","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring systems, UV radiation sensors, mathematical modeling.","People":"Environmental health professionals, researchers, facility managers.","Owner":"Laboratories, environmental health organizations, research institutions."},{"Description":"Unknown UV susceptibility of pathogenic viral aerosols under varying relative humidity (RH) conditions.","Impact":"Lack of understanding about how RH affects the UV susceptibility of pathogenic viral aerosols.","Mitigation":"Conduct studies to evaluate the UV susceptibility of pathogenic viral aerosols at different RH levels and develop guidelines for UV disinfection in environments with fluctuating RH.","Technologies":"Viral aerosol sampling systems, UV radiation testing equipment, epidemiological studies.","People":"Epidemiologists, virologists, public health officials.","Owner":"Public health laboratories, research institutions, government health agencies."}]}
